title: Universidad de Mendoza
text:
The University of Mendoza (<a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a>: "Universidad de Mendoza", UM) is an Argentine <a href="Nonprofit%20organization">non-profit</a> <a href="private%20university">private university</a> in the city of <a href="Mendoza%2C%20Argentina">Mendoza</a> with a branch in the city of San Rafael.
History.
The University of Mendoza was established on December 22, 1959. The university is the oldest and biggest private non-profit institution in the region of <a href="Cuyo%20%28Argentina%29">Cuyo</a>.
Schools.
School of Design, Architecture and Urban Design.
The Department of Architecture has a RIBA/CONEAU-accredited five-year, full-time course of studies in architecture leading to the UM Intermediate Examination (RIBA Part 1) and UM Final Examination (RIBA Part 2).
Academic reputation.
The University of Mendoza has earned recognition for quality in <a href="architecture">architecture</a>, <a href="law">law</a>, <a href="medicine">medicine</a> and <a href="engineering">engineering</a>.
